articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Hamas leaders held a second day of truce talks with Egyptian and Qatari mediators on Sunday, with no apparent progress reported as the Islamist group maintained its demand that any agreement must end the war in Gaza, Palestinian officials said.
articles.title: Gaza ceasefire talks continue in Cairo, Israel pounds the Palestinian enclave

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's cabinet decided on Sunday to shut down Al Jazeera's operations in Israel for as long as the war in Gaza continues, on the grounds the Qatari television network threatens national security.
articles.title: Israeli cabinet votes to shut down Al Jazeera's local operations

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu hardened his rejection of Hamas demands for an end to the Gaza war in exchange for the freeing of hostages, saying on Sunday that would keep the Palestinian Islamist group in power and pose a threat to Israel.
articles.title: Netanyahu says ending Gaza war now would keep Hamas in power

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The number of people killed by flooding and other impacts of the heavy rains battering Kenya has risen to 228, the interior ministry said on Sunday.
articles.title: Death toll from Kenya floods rises to 228

articles.author: John Irish, Ingrid Melander
articles.description: French President Emmanuel Macron will likely urge China's President Xi Jinping, who arrives in Paris on Sunday for a rare visit, to reduce trade imbalances and to use his influence with Russia over the war in Ukraine.
articles.title: France's Macron set to press China's Xi on trade, Ukraine

articles.author: Valentine Hilaire, Elida Moreno
articles.description: Panamanians will head to the polls in Sunday's general election to elect one of eight contenders to be the nation's next president and vote for hundreds of local lawmakers and officials.
articles.title: Panamanians vote in crowded field of presidential contenders

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The "hostile line" of the Baltic countries have led to the severance of most of their ties with Russia, the Russian foreign ministry said in remarks published on Sunday, warning also that Moscow will respond with asymmetric measures.
articles.title: Russia blames Baltic countries for the severing of most ties

articles.author: Dan Williams
articles.description: Israel's Holocaust commemorations this year have a searing significance for six elderly survivors now deeply scarred by the Hamas attacks of Oct. 7 that sparked the ongoing Gaza war.
articles.title: Hamas killing spree haunts Holocaust survivors in 'March of the Living'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Vladimir Putin and scores of other Moscow worshippers attended an Easter service on Sunday, led by the head of Russia's Orthodox Church, Patriarch Kirill, a staunch supporter of the Russian leader and his war in Ukraine.
articles.title: Putin attends Easter service led by head of Russia's Orthodox Church

articles.author: Munsif Vengattil, Saurabh Sharma, Rishika Sadam
articles.description: Manipulated videos are taking centre stage as campaigning heats up in India's election, with fake clips involving two top aides of Prime Minister Narendra Modi triggering police investigations and the arrest of some workers of his rival Congress party.
articles.title: Fake videos of Modi aides trigger political showdown in India election
